{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3144801,"name":"pinkguava06","username":"HarrisonFord","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/harrisonford/{size}/246558_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T18:51:16.782Z","cooked":"

I need the units per revolution for an AndyMark Redline motor. For example, I know the units per revolution of a Falcon 500 is 2048. Thanks.

The andymark redline dose not have a built in encoder, do you have a different encoder mounted to the redline?

I’m using an versaplanetary integrated encoder that’s connected to a TalonSRX on the red line.
I guess I should’ve considered that.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T18:54:53.888Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":43.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":426685,"topic_slug":"andymark-redline-motor-units","display_username":"pinkguava06","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52679,"username":"Rally","name":"Wes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rally/{size}/201273_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56277,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Odd-Denier"},"post_url":"/t/andymark-redline-motor-units/426685/3","custom_user_title":"Odd-Denier","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144806,"name":"Jon K.","username":"Jon_K","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/7cd45c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T18:55:20.355Z","cooked":"

If you are referring to the redline encoder that you can get from AM, then it’s 1024 counts per revolution according to the product page.

andymark.com

RedLine Encoder Kit

The RedLine Encoder Kit is designed to adapt the AM Mag Encoder(am-3479) onto the back shaft of the RedLine Motor. Due to the mounting, it also provides additional support for motor spades. Included in the kit is a magnet adapter, mount board,...

If you’re using the versaplanetary encoder, you would likely need to find that info on that product page. But I’m not as familiar with those.

https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-5046.html
The VP integrated encoder has 1024 ticks per revolution. Make sure you also take into account any reduction between the encoder and the output for your calculations.

Thank you. I factored in the 10-1 gearbox.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-02-13T19:24:09.412Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":24.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":426685,"topic_slug":"andymark-redline-motor-units","display_username":"pinkguava06","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":20681,"username":"Zaque","name":"Zach Hoegberg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zaque/{size}/257827_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56277,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Odd-Denier"},"post_url":"/t/andymark-redline-motor-units/426685/8","custom_user_title":"Odd-Denier","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3144834,"name":"CEF","username":"CEF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/35a633/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-13T19:36:00.214Z","cooked":"

fair warning: A 10:1 versaplanetary gearbox has teeny-tiny little planetary gears that are not quite as strong as, say, the 3:1 or 4:1 planets. Depending on what you’re doing, you might do better off with two 3:1 stages, for a total reduction of 9-1 (or a 3:1 and a 4:1, for 12:1) than with a single 10:1 stage.
